'''Redstone ore''' is the [[ore]] block from which [[redstone]] is obtained.

'''Deepslate redstone ore''' is a variant of redstone ore that can generate in [[deepslate]] and [[tuff]] blobs.

== Obtaining ==
=== Breaking ===
Redstone ore must be mined with an [[iron pickaxe]] or higher to drop [[redstone dust]]. When mined, it drops 4&ndash;5 redstone dust. It is affected by the [[Fortune]] enchantment, dropping 4-6, 4-7, or 4-8 redstone respectively with Fortune I, II, and III (averaging at 6 redstone dust with Fortune level 3<ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20210311215700/https://imgur.com/a/UnIGPKn</ref><ref>https://web.archive.org/web/20230509054859/https://imgur.com/a/GirweJL</ref>). If mined with [[Silk Touch]], it drops itself instead of redstone dust.
{{Breaking row
|Redstone Ore;Deepslate Redstone Ore
|link = none; none
|Pickaxe; Pickaxe
|Iron; Iron
|drop=0; 0}}

=== Natural generation ===
{{see also|Ore (feature)}}
Redstone ore can generate in the [[Overworld]] in the form of ore features. Redstone ore generates in two batches per chunk. The first batch attempts to generate 4 times per chunk, in blobs of 0&ndash;10, evenly from levels -64 to 15. The second batch attempts to generate 8 times per chunk, in blobs of 0&ndash;10, from levels -63 to -32, being more common the lower the elevation.

Redstone ore can replace [[stone]], [[andesite]], [[diorite]], [[granite]], [[tuff]], and [[deepslate]]. Any redstone ore that replaces tuff or deepslate becomes deepslate redstone ore.

Unlike most ores, redstone ore does not generate less when exposed to air.

{{Block distribution}}

== Usage ==
The primary usage of redstone ore is to [[#Breaking|mine]] it for [[redstone dust]].
=== Lit Redstone Ore ===
Lit Redstone Ore is a block state of Redstone Ore or Deepslate Redstone Ore. It produces the [[light level]] of 9 and emits bright red powered redstone particles. Redstone Ore enters this state instantly when it is clicked by a player (including placing any actions such as placing or breaking, and not including middle click) or contacted by an entity on the top side. There are some exceptions, including a [[sneaking]] player, projectiles, [[Shulker|shulkers]], and the [[ender dragon]]. Lit Redstone Ore has a slightly lighter texture, although this is often hard to know in dark areas due to it emitting light, and hard to see in light areas. This effect continues until the redstone ore block receives a [[Tick#Random tick|random block tick]] (averaging 68.27 seconds). This effect does not actually produce redstone power, but the block changes can be detected with an [[observer]] or a [[Tutorial:Block update detector|block update detector]].

Subsequent clickings on a redstone ore block causes it to emit an extra burst of particles per click.

}}

=== Note Blocks ===
Redstone ore can be placed under [[note block]]s to produce "bass drum" sounds.
